definition: in arrears/behind in payments/to default on one's debts
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on

sentences.english: There have been no defaults so far, says the company’s founder, Calvin Chin.
sentences.chinese: 距公司创始人陈国权称迄今为止还没有拖欠记录。

sentences.english: Some homeowners are delinquent, or unable to make the payments on costly, exotic mortgages they took out during the boom.
sentences.chinese: 一些屋主拖欠债务，或者无力支付高额的按揭款。

sentences.english: Rio state employees and pensioners are owed wages in arrears.
sentences.chinese: 里约州的雇员和退休人员被拖欠了工资和养老金。

sentences.english: The prospective default could come in any one of several different flavours.
sentences.chinese: 预期的债务拖欠可以以几种不同的方式到来。

sentences.english: The banks’ troubled debtors are also different.
sentences.chinese: 拖欠银行债务的借方也不同。

sentences.english: He is six week In arrear with his rent .
sentences.chinese: 他拖欠了六个星期的租金。

sentences.english: Membership will be invalidated after 60 days of nonpayment of annual or monthly fee.
sentences.chinese: 拖欠月费或年费60天的会员将被视为自动退出。

sentences.english: He has fallen behind on his mortgage payment and may face foreclosure.
sentences.chinese: 他拖欠房贷付款，也许面临银行收房拍卖。

sentences.english: If you think nobody cares, try missing a couple of payments.
sentences.chinese: 假如你认为没有人关心你，试试拖欠一下应付款。

sentences.english: But at least the second derivative is getting better.
sentences.chinese: 但是至少房屋贷款拖欠率的上升率正在逐渐好转。

sentences.english: Therefore , The Hong Kong-related enterprises will be paid in arrears or close down .
sentences.chinese: 因此，就会出现相关香港企业拖欠货款或倒闭的情况。

sentences.english: Sovereign default is far from inconceivable.
sentences.chinese: 主权国拖欠债务也绝非天方夜谭。

sentences.english: It is obvious today that Baidu has defaulted on this promissory note, insofar as its users from D8 are concerned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，今天百度显然对她的毅丝公民拖欠着这张期票。

sentences.english: The L/C doesn't allow the seller to ship the goods in arrears in the next period of time.
sentences.chinese: 此信用证不允许卖方拖欠运送货物在后一期补交。

sentences.english: More than half of the construction projects, enterprises are in arrears of the existence of the phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 一半以上的建筑业企业都存在被拖欠工程款的现象。

sentences.english: The firm has defaulted on a debt.
sentences.chinese: 该公司拖欠了一笔债务。

definition: to demand payment of money owing
to refuse to accept a payment/to refuse to pay/to stop (a check or payment)
to owe a debt/the sum owed
to break a promise/to violate an agreement/to default (on a loan or contract)
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
